p.k: Frédéric Gassita's biggest influences are Ravel and Debussy, Chick Corea, and Herbie Hancock – whom he met as a student in Boston. His work combines his African roots, rhythms, and orchestral music.
p.d: Frédéric Gassita's biggest influences are Ravel and Debussy, Chick Corea, and Herbie Hancock – whom he met as a student in Boston. His work combines his African roots, rhythms, and orchestral music. Gassita's interest for orchestrations started at the Berklee College in Boston, where he studied music production, sound engineering, and jazz performance for four years. Today, he's conquering Africa with his music style.
